question.qText: Which of these sentences is written accurately in academic voice?

aBtn.aText: The author forces a bland narration on the reader.
The main character doesn’t know he’s in hot water when his roommate returns.
Even though the story is predictable, it has three-dimensional characters that make it fresh.
When Swift used satire to expose the faults of the political system, he went over the heads of his readers.

question.qText: Choose the best option to replace this slang: <font face='lc-Italic'>She was jumping out of her skin before the concert.</font>

aBtn.aText: She couldn’t contain her mind-blowing excitement for the show.
She was holding her breath for the beginning of the show.
She was excited to see her favorite band perform.
She was flipping out for the start of the show.

question.qText: Identify the euphemism(s) in the sentence: <font face='lc-Italic'>This pre-owned car was recently repossessed because the previous owner is between jobs.</font>
